summary.para: Cancels the current write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: There is no write operation currently in progress.

remarks.para: To cancel the write operation, you must call this method from the event handler that you implemented.

Note that calling this method does not immediately cancel the write operation on all media due to media-specific requirements. For example, when writing to a CD, the write operation can continue for up to three more minutes.
This method leaves the media in an indeterminate state. For rewriteable media, you should call the method after calling this method to prepare the media for future use.

summary.para: Determines if Buffer Underrun Free recording is enabled for CDR, CD-RW, and DVD-R media.

param.name: value
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if Buffer Underrun Free recording is disabled; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE (enabled).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Retrieves the friendly name of the client.

param.name: value
param.para: Name of the client application.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: Failed to allocate the required memory.

summary.para: Retrieves the current state of the media in the device.

param.name: value
param.para: State of the media in the disc device. For possible values, see the enumeration type. Note that more than one state can be set.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: One or more arguments are not valid.
Failed to allocate the required memory.

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
The media is inserted upside down.
The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
There is no media in the device.
The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
The drive reported that the media is write protected.
The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.

remarks.para: For an example that uses this property, see Checking Media Support.

summary.para: Retrieves the type of media in the disc device.

param.name: value
param.para: Type of media in the disc device. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.
One or more arguments are not valid.
Note This value does not indicate a NULL pointer.
Failed to allocate the required memory.

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
The media is inserted upside down.
The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
There is no media in the device.
The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
The drive reported that the media is write protected.
The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.

summary.para: Retrieves the current rotational-speed control used by the recorder.

param.name: value
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if constant angular velocity (CAV) rotational-speed control is in use. Otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE to indicate that another rotational-speed control that the recorder supports is in use.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.
One or more arguments are not valid.
Failed to allocate the required memory.

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
The media is inserted upside down.
The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
There is no media in the device.
The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
The drive reported that the media is write protected.
The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.

remarks.para: To retrieve the requested rotational-speed control, call the method.
Rotational-speed control types include the following:

item.description: CLV (Constant Linear Velocity). The disc is written at a constant speed. Standard rotational control.
CAV (Constant Angular Velocity). The disc is written at a constantly increasing speed.
ZCAV (Zone Constant Linear Velocity). The disc is divided into zones. After each zone, the write speed increases. This is an impure form of CAV.
PCAV (Partial Constant Angular Velocity). The disc speed increases up to a specified velocity. Once reached, the disc spins at the specified velocity for the duration of the disc writing.

summary.para: Retrieves the drive's current write speed.

param.name: value
param.para: The write speed of the current media, measured in sectors per second.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.
One or more arguments are not valid.
Failed to allocate the required memory.

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
The media is inserted upside down.
The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
There is no media in the device.
The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
The drive reported that the media is write protected.
The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
The write failed because the drive returned error information that could not be recovered from.

remarks.para: To retrieve the requested write speed, call the method.
To retrieve a list of the write speeds that the recorder and current media supports, call the method.
Note that the write speed is based on the media write speeds. The value of this property can change when a media change occurs.

summary.para: Determines if a DVD recording session includes tasks that can increase the chance that a device can play the DVD.

param.name: value
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the session skips the tasks that allow the disc to play on more consumer devices
Is VARIANT_FALSE if the media will be written to maximize read compatibility with consumer devices.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: This property has no effect on CD media.

summary.para: Determines if further additions to the file system are prevented.

param.name: value
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the next write session ends by marking the disc as closed to subsequent write sessions. Otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE to keep the disc open for subsequent write sessions.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Determines if the data writer must overwrite the disc on overwritable media types.

param.name: value
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the data writer must overwrite the disc on overwritable media types; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Retrieves the number of free sectors on the disc for incremental recording (without overwriting existing data).Note When this method is called for DVD-/+RW, DVD-RAM, and BD-RE media, the reported free sector value represents total capacity, rather than the current number of free sectors. To retrieve free sectors for these media types, the file system must be imported via or , which will allow the use of the method to retrieve the value.

param.name: value
param.para: Number of free sectors on the media in the device.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: One or more arguments are not valid.
Failed to allocate the required memory.

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
The media is inserted upside down.
The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
There is no media in the device.
The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
The drive reported that the media is write protected.
The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
The requested operation is only valid with supported media.

remarks.para: The value of this property is effectively the number of sectors available on disc for the write operation. The value filters sectors consumed in managing the disc space and data quality, such as run-out blocks and postgaps.
Note For overwritable discs, which have only one physical session, the number of free sectors indicated by value will always be the total number of sectors on the disc.
If is set to VARIANT_TRUE, use the property instead.

summary.para: Retrieves the last sector of the previous write session.

param.name: value
param.para: Address where the previous write operation ended.
The value is -1 if the media is blank or does not support multi-session writing (indicates that no previous session could be detected).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: Note This property should not be used. Instead, you should use an interface derived from , such as , for importing file data from the previous session.

summary.para: Retrieves a list of available multi-session interfaces.

param.name: value
param.para: List of available multi-session interfaces. Each element of the array is a VARIANT of type VT_DISPATCH. Query the pdispVal member of the variant for any interface that inherits from interface, for example, .

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: Failed to allocate the required memory.

returns.para: Note This method does not return an error when called on blank optical media.

remarks.para: The array will always contain at least one element.

summary.para: Retrieves the location for the next write operation.

param.name: value
param.para: Address where the next write operation begins.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: One or more arguments are not valid.
Failed to allocate the required memory.

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.

remarks.para: Blank media begin writing at location zero.
In multi-session writing, the next writable address is useful for setting up a correct file system.

summary.para: Determines if the data stream contains post-writing gaps.

param.name: value
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the data stream contains post-writing gaps; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Retrieves the recording device to use for the write operation.

param.name: value
param.para: An interface that identifies the recording device to use in the write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Retrieves the requested rotational-speed control type.

param.name: value
param.para: Requested rotational-speed control type. Is VARIANT_TRUE for constant angular velocity (CAV) rotational-speed control type. Otherwise, is VARIANT_FALSE for any other rotational-speed control type that the recorder supports.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: This is the value specified in the most recent call to the method.

summary.para: Retrieves the requested write speed.

param.name: value
param.para: Requested write speed measured in disc sectors per second.
A value of 0xFFFFFFFF (-1) requests that the write occurs using the fastest supported speed for the media.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: This is the value specified in the most recent call to the method.

To retrieve a list of the write configurations that the recorder and current media supports, call the method.

summary.para: Determines if Buffer Underrun Free recording is enabled. Note This method is only applicable to CDR/RW and DVD+/-R media formats.

param.name: value
param.para: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to disable Buffer Underrun Free recording; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE (enabled).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: There is currently a write operation in progress.

remarks.para: Buffer underrun can be an issue if the data stream does not enter the buffer fast enough to keep the device continuously writing. In turn, the stop and start action of writing can cause data on the disc to be unusable. Buffer Underrun Free (BUF) recording allows the laser to start and stop without damaging data already written to the disc. Disabling of BUF recording is possible only on CD-R/RW media.

summary.para: Sets the friendly name of the client.

param.name: value
param.para: Name of the client application. Cannot be NULL or an empty string.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: Failed to allocate the required memory.
The client name is not valid.
There is currently a write operation in progress.

remarks.para: The name is used when the write operation requests exclusive access to the device. The property contains the name of the client that has the lock.

Because any application with read/write access to the CDROM device during the write operation can use the IOCTL_CDROM_EXCLUSIVE_ACCESS (query) control code (see the Microsoft Windows Driver Development Kit (DDK)) to access the name, it is important that the name identify the program that is using this interface to write to the media. The name is restricted to the same character set as required by the IOCTL_CDROM_EXCLUSIVE_ACCESS control code.

summary.para: Determines if a DVD recording session includes tasks that can increase the chance that a device can play the DVD.

param.name: value
param.para: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to skip the tasks that allow the disc to play on more consumer devices. Removing compatibility reduces the recording session time and the need for less free space on disc.
Set to VARIANT_FALSE to increase the chance that a device can play the DVD. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: There is currently a write operation in progress.

remarks.para: This property has no effect on CD media and DVD dash media.
For DVD+R and DVD+DL media, this property will also affect the media closing operation.

item.description: Closes the disc in compatible mode
Closes the disc in compatible mode
Closes the session for DVD+R Closes disc normally for DVD+R DL

summary.para: Determines if further additions to the file system are prevented.

param.name: value
param.para: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to mark the disc as closed to prohibit additional writes when the next write session ends.
Set to VARIANT_FALSE to keep the disc open for subsequent write sessions. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: There is currently a write operation in progress.

remarks.para: When the free space on a disc reaches 2% or less, the write process marks the disc closed, regardless of the value of this property. This action ensures that a disc has enough free space to record a file system in a write session.
You can erase a rewritable disc that is marked closed.
Note that the property may supersede this property. Please refer to put_DisableConsumerDvdCompatibilityMode for details.

summary.para: Determines if the data writer must overwrite the disc on overwritable media types.

param.name: value
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the data writer must overwrite the disc on overwritable media types; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

summary.para: Determines if the data stream contains post-writing gaps.

param.name: value
param.para: Set to VARIANT_TRUE if the data stream contains post-writing gaps; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: There is currently a write operation in progress.

remarks.para: Note that writing to CD-R/RW media will automatically append a post-gap of 150 sectors, unless this property is explicitly disabled.

summary.para: Sets the recording device to use for the write operation.

param.name: value
param.para: An interface that identifies the recording device to use in the write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: There is currently a write operation in progress.
This device does not support the operations required by this disc format.

remarks.para: The recorder must be compatible with the format defined by this interface. To determine compatibility, call the method.

summary.para: Sets the write speed of the disc recorder.

param.name: RequestedSectorsPerSecond
param.para: Requested write speed measured in disc sectors per second.
A value of 0xFFFFFFFF (-1) requests that the write occurs using the fastest supported speed for the media. This is the default.

param.name: RotationTypeIsPureCAV
param.para: Requested rotational-speed control type. Set to VARIANT_TRUE to request constant angular velocity (CAV) rotational-speed control type. Set to VARIANT_FALSE to use another rotational-speed control type that the recorder supports. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.
One or more arguments are not valid.
Failed to allocate the required memory.

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
The media is inserted upside down.
The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
There is no media in the device.
The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
The drive reported that the media is write protected.
The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
The write failed because the drive returned error information that could not be recovered from.
The requested rotation type was not supported by the drive and the rotation type was adjusted.
The requested write speed was not supported by the drive and the speed was adjusted.
The requested write speed and rotation type were not supported by the drive and they were both adjusted.

remarks.para: This method sets the write speed and type of rotational-speed control for a recorder. Requested values might differ from the values set in the recorder. To specify the recorder, call the method.

If the recorder supports the requested write speed, the disc device uses the requested value. If the recorder does not support the requested write speed, the recorder uses a write speed that it does support that is closest to the requested value. The property contains the value used by the recorder.
To retrieve a list of the write speeds that the recorder and current media supports, call the method.

If you request constant angular velocity (CAV) for rotational-speed control type and the recorder does not support CAV, the disc device uses another type of rotational-speed control type that it supports. The property indicates the value used by the recorder.
To retrieve the requested values, call the and methods.

summary.para: Writes the data stream to the device.Note For write success, the size of the passed-in stream must be a multiple of the sector size, 2048. This includes operations that utilize streams associated with .iso images not created by IMAPI.

param.name: data
param.para: An IStream interface of the data stream to write.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
The media is inserted upside down.
The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
There is no media in the device.
The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
The drive reported that the media is write protected.
The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
The write failed because the drive returned error information that could not be recovered from.
The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.
The requested rotation type was not supported by the drive and the rotation type was adjusted.
The requested write speed was not supported by the drive and the speed was adjusted.
The requested write speed and rotation type were not supported by the drive and they were both adjusted.
This device does not support the operations required by this disc format.
There is currently a write operation in progress.
The size of the provided IStream object is invalid. The size must be a multiple of the sector size, 2048.
The current media type is unsupported.
One or more arguments are not valid.
Failed to allocate the required memory.

remarks.para: Before calling this method, you must call the following methods:
You should also consider calling the following methods if their default values are not appropriate for your application:

This method is synchronous, which means that control is not returned until the provided IStream is recorded to the media. To determine the progress of the write operation, you must implement the interface. For examples that show how to implement an event handler in a script, see Monitoring Progress With Events.

On sequentially recorded discs, the provided is recorded as a new session. On rewritable discs, the provided IStream is always recorded starting from sector 0, but the object providing the IStream interface can also provide the interface listing the sectors that need to be recorded. The IBlockRangeList interface is used to avoid rewriting of sectors that have not changed in multisession scenarios. If the object providing IStream does not provide IBlockRangeList, it is assumed that the entire IStream needs to be recorded.

summary.para: Use this interface to write a data stream to a disc.
To create an instance of this interface, call the CoCreateInstance function. Use__uuidof(MsftDiscFormat2Data) for the class identifier and __uuidof(IDiscFormat2Data) for the interface identifier.

remarks.para: To create the MsftDiscFormat2Data object in a script, use IMAPI2.MsftDiscFormat2Data as the program identifier when calling CreateObject.

It is possible for a power state transition to take place during a burn operation (i.e. user log-off or system suspend) which leads to the interruption of the burn process and possible data loss. For programming considerations, see Preventing Logoff or Suspend During a Burn.
